page.title: 04MERRYDOWN WINES
page.content: A very important business in Horam is the Merrydown Cider Factory.It was founded in 1946 by Jack Wood and Ian Howie.Today it is the fourth largest cider producer in Britain and produces the strongest cider with 7.5% alcohol.One hundred and thirty people work there.During August and September apples are brought from the orchards to be processed,the rest of the year from cold stores.All apples are Kent or Sussex grown.First they are washed and pressed. The press holds eight tons of apples and in 1.5 hours squeezes out 1,200g of juice.This is pumped into oak vats and there sugar and yeast is added and the mixture left for two to three months.Cider is produced and then stored for another nine months to develop its flavour.It is bottled, an automatic bottling machine filling about 35,000 per day.
